intro: Eriogonum deflexum subsp. austrinum, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy clusters of white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, three-lobed seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
